oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Lebanon Missionary Baptist Church, 2001 April
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Mt. Lebanon Missionary Baptist Church located at 1423 Fourth Avenue South in Nashville, Tennessee. This church was built in 1906 as Mt. Lebanon Baptist Church and reestablished in 1955 under the administration of Reverend Joe Gibson, according to the inscription on the cornerstone. The foundation is made of concrete masonry units. The exterior walls are made of common bond brick. The roof has a gable with a wood frame and is composed of composition shingles. The doors are wood with security bars on the outside. There is an eight inch visible section of stone foundation at the rear of the building. The front windows contain special colored glass. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mt. Lebanon Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Mt. Lebanon Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
